metadata.title: CVE-2022-3077 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel Intelâ€™s iSMTSMBus host controller driver in the way it handled theI2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_PROC_CALL case (via the ioctl I2C_SMBUS) with maliciousinput data. This flaw could allow a local user to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3077` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-47-generic - 5.15.0-47.51
linux-image-5.15.0-47-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-47.51
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-47-generic - 5.15.0-47.51
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-47-generic-64k - 5.15.0-47.51
No subscription required
